title: Calligraphy
content:
hi !   
i'm currently doing a design research essay on calligraphy; its functions, role it plays in society, significance in today's design world, characteristics etc. would really really appreciate some opinions/views on this topic. thanks so much !
author: all4aesthetics

comments.content:
There's so much info and resources on calligraphy. Typography has been been largely influenced by it in countless ways. You gotta start somewhere:   
   
 [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calligraphy](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110153710/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calligraphy)

My final year dissertation "The Nine Qualities" from university discusses nine essential characteristics of calligraphy on three different levels of understanding; role of calligraphy in different cultures, etc.   
   
If you are interested, I can mail you the document as a PDF.   
   
Greetings,   
s.
I would like the PDF, Samann! You can find my e-mail via my Typophile profile (click on my name to the left of this message).

I've put the dissertation online at:   
   
 [http://www.saman.rahmanian.at/ninequalities\_72dpi\_medium.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110153710/http:/www.saman.rahmanian.at/ninequalities_72dpi_medium.pdf)   
   
Feedback much appreciated!   
   
The Nine Qualities project culminated in an installation with nine interactive applications (exhibited in London in 2004).   
   
If there is someone who would like the CD-Rom with all nine applications, please contact me directly, to have that arranged.   
   
Greetings,   
s.

oh, by the way - if you open the PDF in Acrobat Reader, make sure you view it in two-page layout mode..   
   
Greetings,   
s.

hey   
jason: thanks but i've already searched wikipedia... i need more of its significance, emotional/spiritual/inspirational aspect of calligraphy...   
samann and alessandro: thanks guys... havent had time to look into the site yet but really appreciate your help...

Law Yi Hua, are you boy or girl ?   
What does you name mean ?   
You are welcome, it is nice to help with that 'few',   
since I spent already 5 years studying/working on/with type &   
calligraphy. And, helping you, I am helping myself, too.

hey !   
u're from rome? it's in italy isnt it? sigh i've always wanted to go there... one of the best places to study art and design...   
haha i'm 101% a girl... it's a chinese name... suppose you have to get used to the culture to differentiate girls and guys..."law" is my family name, "yi" means cheerful and "hua" means magnificent... \*grin\* at least that's what the book says... anyway, i'm 20, a Malaysian and currently studying graphic design...   
unfortunately i cant write till i get old... haha it's due end of this year...uni assignment...

Huau, nice name your parents dropped on you.   
I hope it is not that heavy !   
Yes, I am in Roma, I dress with white linen   
and bay leaves on my head.   
Good luck for your studies,   
are you gonna be a Lawyer ?   
   
cYIao,
